bookTitle: St. Francis of Assisi: Passion, Poverty and the Man who Transformed the Catholic Church

questions.question: What made Bernard believe that Francis was not crazy to be a beggar in Assisi?
questions.correctAnswer: It was his eyes, they were filled with confidence and joy
distractors: His peaceful demeanor despite hardships
The miracles people said he performed
His eloquent preaching in the streets
The way others began to follow him
His knowledge of Scripture and theology

questions.question: Why did Bernard invite Francis to have dinner at his house?
questions.correctAnswer: Because he had noticed Francis' inner serenity, and when Francis asked him to help rebuild the church he said yes and then invited him for dinner
distractors: Because he wanted to learn more about Francis' visions
Because his wife insisted they help this holy beggar
Because he felt sorry for Francis living in poverty
Because he hoped to convert Francis back to normal life
Because the bishop had asked him to help Francis

questions.question: Why did Francis accept Bernard's invitation?
questions.correctAnswer: Because he noticed that Bernard wanted to talk about more than just donating supplies
distractors: Because he was very hungry and needed a meal
Because Bernard was a wealthy and influential man
Because he hoped to convert Bernard's whole family
Because the bishop had encouraged him to accept
Because he needed a place to sleep that night

questions.question: What scripture passages came up at random when Francis and Bernard went to discern God's will together?
questions.correctAnswer: Matthew 19:21 'If you would be perfect, go, sell what you possess and give to the poor...'; Luke 9:3 'Take nothing for your journey'; Luke 9:23 'If any man would come after me, let him deny himself and take up his cross daily and follow me'
distractors: Matthew 5:3-10 The Beatitudes about the poor in spirit
Matthew 25:31-46 Whatever you do to the least of these
Luke 10:1-12 Jesus sending out the seventy-two
Mark 10:17-22 The rich young man
Acts 2:42-47 The early church sharing all things in common

questions.question: What did Bernard decide to do after talking with Francis, praying with him and hearing the scriptures?
questions.correctAnswer: He decided to join Francis and sell all he owned
distractors: He decided to donate half his wealth to the church
He decided to fund Francis' work while keeping his business
He decided to become a hermit in the mountains
He decided to join a monastery
He decided to help Francis but keep his family's estate

questions.question: What was the most powerful instrument Francis had in his evangelization?
questions.correctAnswer: The example of his transformed life
distractors: His eloquent preaching
His knowledge of Scripture
His ability to perform miracles
His poverty and humility
His dedication to prayer

questions.question: What did Bernard's desire to follow Francis confirm for him?
questions.correctAnswer: That Francis was following God's will
distractors: That Francis should start accepting more followers
That Francis' father had been wrong about him
That Francis should write a rule for living
That Francis was destined to be a great saint
That Francis should seek the Pope's approval
